data.question: What is the primary method used to synthesize Na2[IrF6] as described in the article?
data.answer: Na2[IrF6] was synthesized by direct F2 fluorination of Na2[IrCl6]•6H2O at elevated temperature (200°C).

data.question: What experimental technique was used to confirm the absence of hydrolysis products in the synthesis of (PPh4)2[IrF6]•2H2O?
data.answer: Electrospray mass spectrometry was used to confirm the absence of hydrolysis products in the synthesis of (PPh4)2[IrF6]•2H2O.

data.question: How was the electronic ground state of the molecular [IrF6]2– species compared to the {IrO6}8– unit present in all oxido-iridates?
data.answer: The electronic ground state of the molecular [IrF6]2– species was compared to the {IrO6}8– unit present in all oxido-iridates using X-ray magnetic circular dichroism (XMCD) spectroscopy, demonstrating that they possess virtually identical electronic ground states.

data.question: True or False: The synthesis of Zn(viz)4[IrF6] (2) involved the use of 1-vinylimidazole.
What was the purpose of applying a small static magnetic field in the study of magnetization dynamics of the molecular fluorido-iridates?
data.answer: The purpose of applying a small static magnetic field in the study of magnetization dynamics of the molecular fluorido-iridates was likely to decouple the IrIV Jeff = 1/2 from nuclear spins.

data.question: What was the result of substituting oxide ions in [IrO6]8– by isoelectronic fluorides to form the fluorido-iridate: [IrF6]2–?
data.answer: The substitution resulted in the formation of the fluorido-iridate: [IrF6]2–, which has the same electronic ground state as the {IrO6}8– fragment, making it an ideal model for iridates.

data.question: True or False: The magnetic properties and X-ray spectroscopy of the synthesized compounds were studied at temperatures above 100 K.
What was the significance of the branching ratios extracted from XAS in comparing the electronic structure of the molecular [IrF6]2– unit to the {IrO6}8– moieties in oxido-iridates?
data.answer: The branching ratios extracted from XAS were significant because they demonstrated the electronic resemblance between the molecular [IrF6]2– unit and the {IrO6}8– moieties in oxido-iridates, indicating that they possess the same electronic ground state.

data.question: True or False: The study included the synthesis and analysis of a chloride complex, (PPh4)2[IrCl6], to compare its electronic structure with that of fluorido-iridates.
What role did electron paramagnetic resonance (EPR) spectroscopy play in the study of the molecular [IrF6]2– species?
data.answer: Electron paramagnetic resonance (EPR) spectroscopy was used to probe the magnetic anisotropy of the molecular [IrF6]2– species, confirming the presence of strong g-factor anisotropy and supporting the Jeff = 1/2 ground state.
